"Hindi viewers, please don't regret later on when it'll be playing on TV and internet." This is what I mentioned in my review of KGF Chapter 1 after I watched it in cinemas. And today, as I witnessed the second chapter of this epic action saga in cinemas as well, I found myself blown away by the gripping plot, gorgeous visuals, stunning action sequences and most importantly, Yash's screen presence as Rocky. I can safely proceed to state that my expectations were not only met, but also surpassed by this fine sequel.

column3: An improvement over the original in the technical aspects, but not the writing! [+53%]
column4: K. G. F: Chapter 2 is a film that purely runs on technical finesse. There are impressively staged set-pieces, sophisticated production design, a pan-Indian (and possibly international) plot setup, and thumping background score. But the writing, something that didn't work for me in Chapter 1, is still very superficial. In Chapter 2, Rocky (Yash, with commanding screen presence) is no longer an underdog. He has already achieved legendary levels of notoriety with his deeds, even attracting the attention of the nation's Prime Minister. Prashanth Neel is great at crafting mass moments one after the other, in quick succession. The film, as a whole, is a carefully designed collection of mass moments - with frequent interludes of mother-son sentiment and a drab romance.

column3: The perfect mass masala superstar vehicle!
column4: OMG. What did I just watch! KGF Chapter 2 is a blistering, adrenaline-pumping, high-stakes sequel to what was an era-defining part 1 that propelled not just Prashant Neel and superstar Yash but also the entire Kannada film industry, into national prominence. The team has clearly made the best use of the higher budget it received after the first film's success, keeping the emotional resonance from the original intact and building elaborate, well written and intelligently shot and edited mass elevation scenes that will keep you clamouring for more till the awe-inspiring climax.
Teaser & Trailer was nothing ! This movie is a pure master piece .. yash , baaba nailed it !!! My respect to Prashant for directing it in such next level way ... can't wait for chapter 3 !!!!

And for this only reason you can watch it in the cinema halls.

column3: A Sequel well made but Couldn't reach the Greatness of the First One
column4: The Most Anticipated Sequel after Bahubali delivers on a lot of fronts, but misses on a few too. The film starts right from where the first film ended, Rocky taking over KGF & all of his adversaries rushing in to claim their stakes. Instead of the relentless action in the first film, this time you get political & strategic plays, with both sides taking wins & losses. The dialogues are great once again, Performances from Yash, Sanjay Dutt & Raveena Tandon were superb. Great Cinematography & Music that evokes the emotions. The romantic angle is better in this one & the great emotional bond of Mother & Son is once again central to the plot. But there are big issues in screenplay & editing. Instead of the streamlined story of the first film, this one stretches in so many directions & it becomes really tough to keep up with it. A lot of scenes abruptly end & I expected the ending to be much more powerful. A great effort but ultimately falls short of expectations.
Illogical action scenes, weak story line repetatively dragged over and over again.

It is one of the best movies and a history for indian cinemas.

column3: Kannada Cinema in all its Glory
column4: The ambition of the movie KGF is kind of like its lead character Rocky Bhai which is to conquer whatever is possible. Chapter 1 not only made sure Kannada movie industry on the map, but also led to the start of filmmakers taking pan India releases seriously. This was just because of the sheer quality of dubbing, right partnerships and promotion efforts while releasing in other languages. Finally, when KGF Chapter 2 is hitting the screens 3.5 years after its predecessor the cinema lovers across India also across some parts of the world have embraced it with love. KGF is complex and detailed filmmaking at its best for a gangster action drama. Director Prashant Neel's attention to detail is what makes it stand out from the rest of action/drama movies. With only 3 films under his belt in the last 8 years, it looks like he has already established his brand of filmmaking.
Time is precious, please don't waste it watching movie like this.

column3: Mass scenes, Mass scenes.. Mass scenes a bunch of mass scenes
column4: KGF 2 starts off pretty good but later on its just more like a mashup of mass scenes. KGF 2 is blessed by a strong cast starting from Yash's Rocky which is the sole factor to watch the whole movie. His ravishing presence carries the whole movie upto an extent. Raveena Tandon is another factor to watch put for because her stern character was hell of a surprising delight. Coming to mass scenes, although most of them did not land well for me..Rocky's entry, return etc where top notch scenes which are not to be missed.

Huge fan of Chapter 1, which had much more direct plot and gave Rocky a good character arc, while still making him appear like a very cunning, gray character. Chapter 2 has a fast-paced screenplay too, but it collapses under the weight of all the characters and story that has to be packed in. Rocky doesn't have very much room to grow as a character and is overall just a vessel to deliver elevation scenes. However, in Chapter 2 the elevation scenes don't land nearly as well as the movie lacks the emotional depth of the first. When the screenplay is shifting from place to place quickly and rushing through plot points, there is not much room to setup stakes and emotional payoff, which is this film rings hollower than Chapter 1. Chapter 1's first half is basically how all of Chapter 2 plays out, except the novelty of style and new characters from Chapter 1 is gone since Chapter 2 is the sequel.
The first part was really good corresponding action, acting and overall story-building.
Watched in prime today and lost my 1/2 hr of life ðŸ˜©, thank god remaining 2hrs was rescued by switching off my tv.

column3: What does not kill you makes you a bigger achiever .
column4: What worked: One of the challenges while making the movie to make the viewers relate and convince them that the story is engaging. This movie is a winner for that matter. The movie is bigger, better and interesting, and even more engaging that the first chapter. The lead characters are commendable in their role. Sanjay Dhatt and Raveena were well introduced in their roles, added the needed spice and interest in the movie. It's amazing that a movie with this budget could hold the scale and execution in such a believable and engaging story. The narrative is well written , characters well acted, well edited, scored, mixed and produced. The movie with the budget could pull a production and execution makes a case study for the film makers as to how to execute and narrate the story. And for that matter director deserves the praise for keeping all the departments well balanced in their respective roles as a film makers. I am sure the film makers across are watching the movie with an awe and an opportunity to research how to make a movie with the scale, execution, acting and overall making of the movie. We have been hearing about a young and bright editor of the movie . I am sure everyone has an eye on him after this movie. The movie excites and eagers us for the next chapter of the great combo of Yash and Prashant's next venture, and we can say the movie is a benchmark and path breaker for the Indian movie industry to learn what can be achieved with the right vision and execution as the movie has rare dull moments but lots of punchlines and treats that keeps the jaws dropping for most parts of the movie What did not work: Very few scenes come to my head as what can and needs to be changed in this movie, making it better than the first chapter. Maybe the love song could have been shortened like other songs but hey who am I to say since the movie works overall for the most part which is quiet rare. So, even with plot holes, if any, movie works big time for the viewers to enjoy the ride.

column3: One Of The All Time Blockbuster Movie Of India Film Industry
column4: The story and screenplay of KGF 2 is awesome in one word. One scene after another inside the movie is so good and gives so much goosebump that the body will tremble at the sight. There are scenes like this in a movie that I have never seen before. I have never seen such scenes in Hollywood movies. Yash's entry scenes in the film - Adheera's entry scenes, action scenes, climax scenes, and even the post-credit scene are awesome. I salute the director of the film Prashanth Neel for giving such a movie as a gift. There is no hero to my knowledge that anyone can match the style, attitude, dialogue delivery expression of the hero of the film Yash. The heroine of the film Srinidhi Shetty's acting in the movie is very good. No one else can do the character that Sanjay Dutt has done as a villain in such a beautiful way. Raveena Tandon's performance is very remarkable and she has acted in a powerful character. The background music is even better which has helped a lot to enhance the movie. Complete family 'movie. No boring scenes. Everyone should see. If no one sees this movie then he will make a big mistake in his life. The movie is one of the best movies in the Indian film industry.

Disappointed to see, no where the movie is able to engage, director seems to be in hurry. Such a waste of time. It's the most nonsense movie I have ever watched. KRK's review is absolutely right. Too much Slo-Mo scenes But Sanjay Dutt looks awesome.

The movie is just like a person without backbone, it has good action and filmography but story and direction which is most important for movie is worst. The movie is full of plotholes and many points in story just don't connect. Unlike other good gangster movies where everything done as a plan by gangster is explained, in kgf, rocky is just making things happen without things being explained to viewers. Story is so predictable, in almost quarter of movie, you will know what will happen in end. Kgf 1 was good but this one is just pouring money is filmography and savageness while neglecting most important part of a movie, the story. Dialogues are cringe most of time, except for rocky and adheera, other characters are too shallow and the goal of not a single character seemed defined.

He was a bad guy who was really good, making his ass-kicking scenes gratifying to watch.

column3: Pan Indian Blockbuster Action Thriller Movie
column4: A Story of mother & Son . Mother wants to her son would became a rich man . Son (Rocky) Promise to his mother that he (rocky) become a rich of the the world. Now, In KGF Chapter 2 Rocky Become a Top rich man of the world. Mind Blowing Story, Screenplay, Direction.

Thrill Thrill Thrill.... The Movie Was Awesome. And Its Fully Back Ground Music And Mass Dialogues . And The Screenplay Was Very Good. We Will Watch The Movie Full Without Boring. Only Some Lags. But Movie Is Perfect..

I don't have any words to appreciate this Blockbuster movie. After watching this epic film I felt totally speechless and I felt emotional during watching it. I want to appreciate the Exceptional Pan-India Megastar Rocking Yash for brilliantly portraying his acting and I want to appreciate both the actors who portrayed the role of antagonists in this Film Sanju Baba and Raveena Tandon and I want to appreciate the Director Prashanth Neel for accurately directing this Masterpiece and last but not the least I want to appreciate all the cast, crew members, cinematographer, writer, editor, background music score artist for creating outstanding background music, etc for making this movie possible and making it an emotion to the KGF fandom.

My honest opinion is that, this movie is just like the first chapter, no more no less. With its hype, we had a very high expectations but it could not meet those expectations. This does not mean the movie is disappointing, everything is just like the its previous chapter and I enjoyed each and every part of it. This movie is totally worth watching for its scale, dialogue and action. Don't have any expectations. No expectations, no disappointment. I personally wish, something had to be different for it to become a masterpiece.

column3: Too loud... Simple south mass masala....

BGM is TOO LOUD, I mean way too LOUD. Even during normal conversation of characters, BGM is unnecessarily loud and fast. Seriously what's wrong with music directors of this movie. Never experienced such kind of overly loud BGM. And also, loud doesn't mean good. By the time movie gets over, you will develop headache.

column3: NOT ROLLERCOASTER BUT A MONSTER ðŸ‘¹ COASTER
column4: Written and directed by Prasanth Neel who made people anxious and crazy about his love for the character of Rocky from KGF 1 finally arrives in theatres after a long gap of almost 3 and a half years. Well arrival is such an understatement for this movie, it shreds the box office like anything you have previously seen on a big screen. I have never seen fans so anxious and crazy about a movie since Avengers finale and I have got to tell you that this is the most overwhelming movie experience I have had of any Indian Movie in cinemas ever period. People were literally shouting and cheering even before the Big title showed on the screen and it definitely marks the greatest entrance of a character in a movie. Not to mention I went to the last show possible in the theatre near me and I wasn't expecting it to be houseful at midnight but God am I glad to be wrong.

column3: Cringy, overhyped and a bad movie made grandly.

Good that it made lots of money n a pan India hit, Satyajit Ray once told that Indian audiences don't have the taste for good movies, its once again proved right with KGF 2. People not just deserve the Govt they voted for they also deserve the cringy movies which they made hit. Can be compared with RRR but not with Pushpa which had some nicely written script followed by some good acting by Allu Arjun n others.

column3: KGF 2 (and KGF-1 too) will forever be known as emotions
column4: I am writing this after my second viewing and have to say I loved KGF-2 more the second time. And I already have an urge to watch it one more time very soon. The feeling you get after watching this movie cannot be evoked just by the story, script, bgm, epic scale, spectacle, gorgeous cinematography, humor, actors, or emotional scenes. They all are necessary, but more importantly they also have to blend well. KGF-2 blends them all so well that it lingers around for a long time with you. The impact is so deep that you can't watch any other movie for a few days. And that's what compels you to watch KGF-2 again and again, until you overdo it.

Only the story and mass is better than the chapter 1. I don't know why they mixed all themes and then bent it into one and played it so loudly in the theaters. The music was so unique in part one but in this case i can't able to differenciate the themes of characters. Dialogues were so pure. Every character in the film seems like waiting for giving their solo dialogues so that rocky can give entry in slow-mo. Hugely disappointed.

Chapter 2 is nothing compared to chapter 1. There are only a few scenes that made this film worth watching. Sanjay Dutt seems waste in the whole film; Just his look is dangerous but in the script nothing more than a killer of Reena. Action sequences should have been long and continued instead of having a black screen every 1 second when you tried to understand 'what's going on?'. Chapter 2 fails to create an impact like the previous one. The trailer was Mind-blowing but wish I could say this for the film.
Love love love this masterpiece ! Yash is amazing and Prashant neel a brilliant storyteller. One of the finest movies I have seen in a long long timez.

column3: Watchable. Only for Mass Audiences who just want fun. Could've been much better.
column4: The opening scene is energy-filled and displays fast-paced flashbacks just like Chapter 1. But after 5-10 minutes, you realize this is no more than a mere mass masala formula film
The movie never tried to take itself so serious, so I wonder why people are judging it with so much discontent.

The story of Rocky's ruling and how he overcomes all the challenges is absolutely amazing. The final plot twist was also a bit unexpected and made the show a lot better. In this movie Rocky's love for his mother and the promise he made to her which no matter what he had to do he never backed down from fulfilling the promise. There was also more romance than in the first movie and the monstrosity of Rocky is terrifying and marvelous. Hopefully, the next movie is also good like this or even better.

After the assassination of garuda, Andrews,desai, guru pandian and kamal are shocked to see that rocky has also killed its successor virat and taken the rule of KGF. Rocky rehabilitates the slaves and creates his own army. He also kidnaps reena and makes her stay with him. Meanwhile, adheera returns to reclaim kgf and also ramika sen becomes the prime minister and swears to destroy kgf. How rocky deals with these new enemies and what happens to him in the end forms kgf chapter 2.

An ultra larger than life superhero, who looks invincible. Scenes like the hero manages to deal with 40 attackers at a time and none of them has a gun to shoot him down even though all are gangsters. Funny scenes like people are scared of his name and start to pay undue respect out of fear look utterly nonsensical.

column3: A saga worthy to be called one of Indias great
column4: I won't say much but I would say this is the only Indian movie saga that compares to some of the great ones. The movie is packed with everything you can imagine in an entertainment package.

KGF2 - One should accept that if there could be a movie which can have a mass opening in par with a Bahubali, a RRR and many other it can only be KGF2. Flabbergasted by the kind of reception this movie had from the very beginning title card . It was indeed Larger than life. It took me 3.5 years to watch KGF 1 and that was a huge miss but this time I ensured not to make the same mistake and I did KGF2 in about 48hrs of release and I feel superbly happy . I repeat , the directors vision, control on the story and the screenplay, everything was at its best . Ravi Basrur, never heard before KGF and can never forget post either, brilliant music may it be songs or BGM. His contribution brought in so much life to the movie . Bhuvan Gowdaf for excellent cinematography, it was a different and amazing world altogether. And there was this whole load of actors including Sanjay Dutt, Raveena , Prakashraj, Srinidhi , Easwari Rao weaving this wonderful movie with a solid needle called Yash . Undoubtedly he pulls out his life's finest performance here and without missing even a inch he perfectly fits to the character . He's Super Smart and Sema Fit . I bet , none but him could have done this role any better . Salam Rocky Bhai. This is not just a movie but an experience. Loved every bit of it . Huge respect to director Prashanth Neel , words can't just say the kind of work he has put in . Class apart . I would say, The real BEAST of this season is ROCKY. Overall KGF, King of Great Films.

KGF 2 - one of the best theatrical experience I ever had,The major positive is narration director just nailed it,The visuals, music and Yash with his screen presence,Kudos to all technicians...Worth all the hype.
Movies are a crafted art where it will make you to believe the unbelievable. Prashant Neel as the captain of this ship completely excels in that.

column3: A Tragedy Coated in Masala Elements
column4: Right from the outset (the intro) you know what you're into. You're not watching KGF 2 to see some artistic masterpiece, you're watching it for a commercial mass-terpiece. And it fulfils its role extremely well, with dizzying action sequences made only better by the frantic camera movement, and dialogues that have just as much power as Rocky's hammer.

Prashanth Neel sir,the next time you make a movie, please reduce the volume of BGM which lasts for almost the entire movie (which is the only flaw this movie has). But the direction and cinematography cannot be replaced by anyone....... I am wondering what did I watch even though it was easy for me to understand, because such is the imagination and hype of Prashanth Neel.... Send him to Hollywood There was no flaw in any character played and the story narration in Ugram style was excellent. In the beginning I felt there was a bit lag due to irritating loud music but the moment you get out off the cinema hall your mind will be busy digesting the next level scenes....those thoughts are still bouncing for a next visit even though one could easily understand the twisted story.
Watch and learn copy paste Bollywood... especially The Old Khan's..action+story+emotion haters will hate.. if you think you are bad , im(Yash) your dad.. :)

I can assure you, if you watch this without any bias and try to enjoy it the way director wants you to this will give goosebumps more times then you can imagine. Every single aspect of this movie and even the smallest details in every scene are so thoughtful and visually pleasant that you would surely notice the brilliance. Everyone should give it atleast one chance.

But here in Chapter 2, director Prashant Neel immerses us completely in the world of KGF and from there ROCKY Bhai Yash takes over & rides the journey with many twists and turns with his awesome style, Hollywood level action, Bold charisma, whistle-worthy dialogues, his hard hitting punches & punchlines, delivering a KING-SIZED ENTERTAINMENT !!.

I cut down one star because i feel that music is overused(which isn't necessary bad because its bgm is good), but at few scenes the cuts could have been longer (Although better than previous movie). But The movie really delivers to its hype!!!

KGF is not a movie but an emotion. Yash is not an actor but a firebrand. The movie is high on style and substance. Sanjay dutt as the antagonist is menacing so is Raveena tandon as Ramika sen. The sound design bgm is bigger and better. Cinematography with the desaturated lighting is Hollywoodesque. Action choreography is the best u will have witnessed. Overall if u loved Kgf 1 u will go insane with kgf2. Mass.. mass. Mass.
The most awaited movie, I saw this movie in theatre, I was stunned.it was worth.i can't stop myself to see this movie on Repeatation.yash, sanjay sir , raveen just nailed it.

KGF chapter 2 starts where it left on Chapter 1.

Ohhh my god! What a movie that was. Pure entertaining mass action masala movie. I just loved the direction of Prashant Neel Sir. Yes ofcourse there are few illogical moments but that's the beauty of his direction. His direction will keep you away from those moments. Your attention will only be on that scene. The build up behind those scenes are amazing. Brilliant cinematography. Kudos to the cinematographer ðŸ‘ðŸ‘ðŸ‘ðŸ‘. Let me now talk about the performances of every actor. OMG!! Yash, Yash and Yash amazing performance. Apart from that, Sanjay Dutt stands out as a menacing villain in a gruesome avtaar and ofcourse, the comeback of Raveena Tandon in a short but powerful act. Brutal action, top notch performances, Stunning visuals, Heart-thumping background score and the climax makes this a must watch.
Go and watch it in theater.... It will boost ur energy ðŸ˜Ž

column3: Movie is total disaster....save ur mind and body from this
column4: I come with great expectations for the movie after its chapter 1 success. As I entered the theatre movie starts with boom and ends with boom. Have some mercy on viewers. But I even more shocking that people are appreciating the movie by giving shoutouts and whistle. Every background artist behind the main leads doing overacting and over melodramatic acting that I didn't connect with. Emotional scene are full with loud BGM. I never seen anyone doing this. Instead of making us emotional I find it funny. One more aspect for not liking the movie is story telling . It too fast pace. There is a entry after entry of main leads with loud BGM throughout the film. There is scene in the movie where adhera hold the bridge with one hand and multiple jeeps are passing through it. There are many scenes of Yash which shows him a superhuman or video game character. Who will do this in real life. And one more drawback action scenes are closely shooted only there upper body is taken which resulted in less detail.

column3: Good And best movie on this year

column3: A larger-than-life, highly enjoyable rags to riches, urchin to overlord movie.
column4: A larger-than-life, highly enjoyable rags to riches, urchin to overlord movie. The dialogue is cutting and immensely funny, the action is out of this world, and the emotional storyline is very moving. Kash plays Rocky brilliantly, and Sanjay Dutt is an amazing nemesis. The movie seems like a modern-day myth, or a lost city of El Dorado and its untold riches. Brilliant and definitely worth sitting through the epic 5-hour story.

column3: A VISUAL GRANDEUR & BENCH MARK FOR INDIAN CINEMA...!
column4: Prashanth Neel now joins the elite club of great iconic directors of Indian cinema be it tna making,value of script,narration or writing,deserves an applause....gives out a clear msg to bollywood makers to forget their propaganda or nepotism...Ravi basrur bgm and sound mixing is Oscar worthy and forms core of the film...UJWAL KULKARNI is now the youngest editor of Indian cinema and his works are out of the box and does glorify the film to new level...the emotional contents in the 2nd half shows the director is not intended to give just a commercial hit but shows is ability in mastering the art of direction...the sleek cuts in action sequences takes a next level of editing and especially the car chase sequence and it's bgm will rip u apart if u watch it in a good Audi theatre...overall KGF 2 is a visual extravaganza and pride of South Indian films...what could have been better is screenplay with indepth detailing instead of spending more on sets.

column3: He is the BIGGEST criminal, he is the BIGGEST business man, this is the BIGGEST national issue!
column4: K. G. F: Chapter 2 was directed by Prashanth Neel and stars once again Yash as Rocky Bhai, the new kingpin of Kolar Gold Fields (also known as K. G. F.). Srinidhi Shetty, Archana Jois, Malavika Avinash, Ayyappa P. Sharma, Harish Rai and Dinesh Mangaluru reprise their roles from the first chapter, while Sanjay Dutt, Raveena Tandon, Saran Sakthi, Eswari Rao and Prakash Raj are the new cast members in this sequel. Chapter 2 is definitely a step-up, compared to the last installment. It's bigger and better, and the production value and action sequences have vastly improved. K. G. F: Chapter 2 is, without a doubt, a commercial film, but the difference between this movie and other Indian commercial films is that the movie relies heavily on the script. The film is 2 hours and 48 minutes long, and it doesn't waste any single frame during the entire runtime. There isn't one unnecessary scene that feels it doesn't belong in the script. Kudos to the producer, Vijay Kiragandur for understanding and sharing Prashanth Neal's vision, for appreciating this bold script and for letting Neel execute the film exactly how he wanted.

Worth the hype !!!.... KGF chapter 2 , mass action thriller was really a great sequel . It completely satisfies the hype created by Part 1 . It's completely a Rocky Bhai's show , his characterisation and mannerism was pure lit . Mass action sequence , dialogues and buildup were just awesome as part 1 . Yash as Rocky Bhai gave terrific performance . Sanjay Dutt as Adheera was stunning in look , but his characterisation was not that much impressive as I thought . Raveena Tandon done her job well . Prashanth Neel way of handling commercial cinema is quite unique . First half was well made , screenplay was engaging , especially interval block . Second half was also good , but lagged in few places . This time mother sentiment quite didn't worked . Technically movie was great comparing to it's previous part , especially music and cinematography was mind blowing . Overall a well made sequel , please don't miss it to watch it on big screen .

column3: Commendable Action Scenes Powerful Acting&Swag Less Intriguing Storyline
column4: So gave a watch to the most hyped film ever, it was a good one time watch action thriller with very amazing action scenes and powerful acting but a bit not so exciting story that keeps you glued to the screens and make you wonder wt will happen next(Though the ending was commendable). Yash does a really good job with his swag and also carries action scenes amazingly well, Srinidhi shetty here gets a lengthier role compared to the 1st part and she also does well especially in the climax scene with her emotions, Raveena tandon also makes her presence felt and she as well does a good job with her expressions and bossy attitude, Sanjay dutt ws extra ordinary as the main antagonist adheera and he does a really commendable performance. The action of the film is vry well directed and structured, wat i didn't like was the story had no vry intriguing depth that can justify the film in overall. Nevertheless despite some flaws KGF 2 is a great one time watch action thriller film, I rate it 7/10 starz.

column3: Average at best, this film does the style way better than the substance
column4: KGF Chapter II will remain one of the most technically sound films made in India. Be it the expansive set design or the brilliant camerawork or even those lavish suits that Rocky wears, or the makeup on Adheera, KGF's technical department deserves all praise for making a grand contribution to this magnum opus BUT it is the story and overdose of machismo that makes a dent in the experience and leaves an average aftertaste. It might have the so-called spices that makes up a summer blockbuster but the screenplay is quite immaterial, hardly written with thought and care, and even to a point predictable. And Raveena Tandon does the finest in the acting department while the others only scream and yell - if only that could be called acting?! Yash does fine in getting the commanding presence required of his messiah plus gangster plus monster image in Rocky but his style and panache does get in the way of actual emoting. Also dubbing in Hindi could have been better.

Too much overhyped movie with so many scenes with hero elevations,bgm was too much.direction is poor.due to hype I went for movie on 2nd day and totally disappointed.atleast kgf has sentiment and story.but kgf 2 doesn't fit.
I dont have any words to tell about this movie, words are not enough to describe the greatness of this movie. It is Never before and ever after Movie It is an Unbreakable and UnStoppable Movie.

For all those bitching about this being over the top, well, it's clearly meant to be the Chuck Norris of India. The whole premise is that this is being told as a legend so the dramatisation is fully justified to add spice to the story.
NO- logic, depth of story, connection with reality, risky stunts, high budget car chases BUT YOU CAN'T AVOID this film if you are an action loving Indian cine goer.

Prashanth Neel clearly knows how to elevate a mass scene and how to present a goosebumps scenes to the audience. That's what he did in the Movie, placing goosebumps scenes at every 5 minutes on his screenplay. Rocky is larger than life character.. No he's more than that so it's not easy to convince the audience that whatever he does but Neel convincingly delivered it. He created a dark World called KGF and pulled the audience into it to see the Action adventure of Rocky. People love rebellious stories but here Rocky was not completely a Rebel but people in kgf see him as the one, that's also the main reason audience loving this movie.

Warning: Spoilers KGF - Chapter 1, set the tone for a slick gangster franchise-high on style and details. The first part was all about establishing the intentions and power of Raja Krishnappa Bairya aka Rocky Bhai. The second part has managed to create hype with its promotional content that gives a peek into the film. Does the film manage to match the build-up? It does and provides a better sequel and also has a big surprise for fans in the end, too.

column3: The best Indian Action movie of all time.
column4: You have to watch this movie in a theatre. The theatre experience is off the charts. The cinematography is just beautiful. Normally I don't like fast paced edits but it totally works for this movie. The bgm is just something else. Every shot, every dialogue is intended to give you goosebumps. The only issue I have is the character development. But that would've meant a slow pace. This is one of the rare occasions where the director executes his vision to perfection.

Right through K. G. F: Chapter 2, I couldn't help but imagine what it must have been like for Prashant Neel to watch The Godfather for the first time. More than the whole film, I'd love to ask him someday about the impact its climax left him with as he watched it in what I imagine to be an old theatre, wherever he grew up. Like the iconic theatre scene in Cinema Paradiso, this moment must have been Prashanth's big life-altering moment, his metamorphosis where he not only discovered the magic of movies but also the concept of "mass" before it became a thing. Without sounding too dramatic, something must have clicked in him because there's no one here who thinks in intercuts like this man.

The Rocking Star Yash was just amazing as Rocky Bhai and Sanjay Dutt was the perfect villain as Adheera and almost every actor did a great job in making the movie this good. Don't miss this movie and please try and watch it in the theater.

column3: A masterpiece of 3I's - Indelible, Incredible, Immense
column4: The much awaited sequel of KGF-1 is absolutely worth the wait (of 2 long years). The plot, flow, sequence, cinematography, action and everything was on point and subtle to the core. Rocky's role couldn't have been played by any other actor. He's the man who's made for it - The One and Only Masterpieceâ¤ðŸ”¥! The eternal bond between Rocky and Reena, their purest form of love and her audacity are mind-boggling and heartwarming. His mother's name was finally revealed in this chapter. Her puissant relation with Rocky, her words had an immense effect on his life, right from the beginning. In fact, it was truly she who kept him going and combat all his ferocious and heinous combatants who had constantly been backstabbing him. The new roles introduced in this chapter have a big say and the climax made me speechless. But I'm glad about the closing theme giving us a surprise too. The hype created is absolutely worth it! Overall, it is certainly the #PrideOfKarnataka in every way. A fantastic present to the film industry by our Sandalwood. Prashant Neel sir has aced itâœ¨ðŸ’¥! #ProudKannadathi & #ProudFanGirlOFYashâ¤ðŸ’¥

KGF - CHAPTER 2 Hindi is the story of a man who faces new challenges after successfully taking over an empire. Rocky kills Garuda (Ramachandra Raju) in the Kolar Gold Fields, aka, KGF, and takes charge, much to the annoyance of Guru Pandian (Achyuth Kumar), Andrews (B S Avinash), Rajendra Desai (Lakki Lakshman). They had expected to rule KGF and take over its immense wealth. However, Rocky, with the help of the slaves who consider him a messiah, usurps the throne. He even kills Virat (Vinay Bidappa), brother of Garuda and the heir apparent to the KGF throne. Rocky however spares Vanaram (Ayyappa P Sharma), the commander of the army at KGF. Vanaram, angry at first, joins Rocky and trains young kids who become the new guards of the territory. Rocky discovers that there are several unexcavated mines in the area and he orders the men to start extracting gold from these places. The idea is to discover as much gold as possible in the shortest possible time. Meanwhile, Adheera (Sanjay Dutt), brother of Suryavardhan, the founder of KGF, was presumed dead. However, he is alive and arrives at KGF for revenge and to claim ownership. He smartly gets Rocky out of KGF and shoots him. He allows Rocky to survive so that the word is spread in KGF that the terrifying Adheera is here. Rocky recuperates but realizes that no one is able to move out of KGF as Adheera's men have surrounded the mines. Meanwhile, Shetty (Dinesh Mangaluru), Rocky's ex-boss in Bombay, has tied up with fellow gangsters across West and South India, and plans to act against Rocky. They are also dealing with Inayat Khalil (Balakrishna), a dreaded gangster from Dubai. How Rocky fights all these elements forms the rest of the film. Prashanth Neel's story is excellent and pays a nice tribute to the angry-young-man and gangster films of Amitabh Bachchan of the 70s and 80s. Prashanth Neel's screenplay is highly captivating. Despite such a vast storyline and so many characters, his writing flows smoothly. Also, he is aware that audiences expect a lot of massy stuff from KGF - CHAPTER and in this regard, he makes fans very happy as he has peppered the narrative with plenty of clapworthy scenes. The Hindi dialogues are very powerful and further enhance the commercial appeal of the film. A few scenes work big time just due to the acidic one-liners..

column3: salaam rocky bhai ilaka tera bhai tu hai sabka bhai
column4: Prashanth Neel returns as writer-director in KGF: Chapter 2, starring Yash as the gold-hearted gangster named Rocky. But first, a recap. The first chapter was a Deewar-like story of a young boy coming to Bombay and becoming a famous gangster. And then, he is sent to Karnataka, where he becomes even more famous: he becomes the messiah of the people of a secret mining town called KGF. We met Rocky's enemies like Shetty bhai in Bombay and Inayat Khalil in Dubai. We met the Indian Prime Minister, a woman whose face was never revealed, a woman who spoke of unleashing the army on Rocky while signing the death warrant of the man she considered "the biggest criminal in India."

column3: One of the greatest and finest sequel Indian film fans from whole over the word ever see.
column4: KGF 2 is the best Indian film I have watched this year. Every aspect of this film was giving me goosebumps moments , from the cinematography which presented the in a grade A manner, action sequences which pushes the audience to the edge of the seat, CGI which pins Rocky's KGF city into everyone's mind, the screenplay which never once gave the of feel lag throughout the long duration of the movie, the editing which was on point and BGM the flare to whole of the film. Prashanth Neel and Yash have handled the movie like the precious gold of KGF itself. Not just Yash but every characters played their part in this film disregarding the recurring or new faces in the film, especially Sanjay Dutt and Raveena Tandon whose character came with high expectations. Since I watched the film in tamil, hats off to dialogue writer for the memorable line. KGF 2 clearly one of the best Kannada movies. Its clearly a 10/10 film.

The blood-soaked land of Kolar Gold Fields (KGF) has a new overlord now - Rocky, whose name strikes fear in the heart of his foes. His allies look up to Rocky as their savior, the government sees him as a threat to law and order; enemies are clamoring for revenge and conspiring for his downfall. Bloodier battles and darker days await as Rocky continues on his quest for unchallenged supremacy.

Neither such a film was made, nor will it ever be made, (both parts) What should I say, if you talk about rating, then 1 point out of 10 is not there to reduce. The story and direction are so tight that you can't even blink and There are so many twists and turns in the story that you cannot imagine. Where the first part of the story ended, the second part takes it to the top. It is very difficult to take the story of any film to another part and above, but the director has done wonders.

column3: Not so good as I expect; Lacks serious story telling.
column4: Compared to KGF Chapter 1 the Chapter 2 is not what I expected. The movie's story and narration takes a big chunk of excitement and it upsets me a lot. Half time into the movie, the movie felt just "Boring". There is fantastic background music and hero elevations through the screen time. But the lack of coherence In the story telling combined with some very fast paced editing make the whole thing feel uninspired and gore. It feels that the movie could have done much better story-wise. Overall, it's watchable, but not memorable.

Best movie ever. In 2018, the blockbuster film KGF: Chapter 1 got released. Chapter 2 is the sequel to it. Vijay Kiragandur under the banner Hombale Films produces the film, directed by Prashanth Neel. Rockstars Yash, Srinidhi Shetty, Sanjay Dutt, and Raveena Tandon play the leads, while Prakash Raj, Malavika Avinash, Eswari Rao, and others provide supporting roles. Ravi Basrur composed the music, and Bhuvan Gowda handled the cinematography.

column3: Ignore the movie a a fiction, imagine a movie where you have the balls to do what's you dreamt to do
column4: Loads of points in the movie are far fetched, loads of points are unrealistic. But imagine a person within the current society who doesn't give a sh**. He has goal though unrealistic, but the one was set up by his poor dying mother. This movie is about going through things to achieve these pre-destined Goliaths. The protagonist though unreal resembles a multiverse where a common pneumoniac kid destined to die, can grow up to be an inhuman but still bleed driven by a weakness( his humane side )which propels him to save some if not all. Loads of review online discuss about an over the top story, and I agree but my question to them is, why do you watch a movie? To forget your present, sometimes to remember the past, and sometimes to look for the future. Why can't there be a movie which talks about a resembling past (the ravina tondon performance did remind me of our own Iron Lady with all her shortcomings), a motivation less covid stricken present (where every one is confined to their own dark deep mines) and a selfless future (where your being is in commensalism with others). But just forget about all my bull sh**, watch the movie with a lovely sound track, on a Dolby sound, forget about the in-consequentialness of life, and remember the incapabilities of a father to create another Rocky (pun intended). You will get it when you watch the first half. Thanks.

Best movie in world cinema. ByMonika Rawal Kukreja It was only recently that I sat down to watch KGF part 1 and in all honesty, I didn't understand most of it. With a screenplay that was all over the place, characters getting introduced at a pace faster than a meteoroid's crash, and a story that picked up only post-interval, I was a bit lost too early on in the film. It was only Yash's introduction scene and his superlative performance that I thoroughly enjoyed. Also read: Prashanth Neel on KGF 3: 'If people love it, we could continue the franchise'

KGF 2 Review: 'KGF:Chapter 1' set the tone for a slick gangster franchise-high on style and details. The first part was all about establishing the intentions and power of Raja Krishnappa Bairya aka Rocky Bhai. The second part has managed to create hype with its promotional content that gives a peek into the film. Does the film manage to match the build-up? It does and provides a better sequel and also has a big surprise for fans in the end, too.

Speechless terrifying extraordinary best movie in the World. Yash, the popular actor in Kannada cinema, won the hearts of the Tamil audience with the massive action thriller 'KGF: Chapter 1', and the film's dubbed version had a magical theatrical run in Tamil Nadu. Yash is now back with the release of 'KGF: Chapter 2', and the Pan Indian release has hit the big screens today. Due to high expectations, 'KGF 2' has got special shows in Tamil Nadu too, and the film opened with an early morning show. Fans didn't fail to catch the action drama, and they share their reviews on Twitter once they complete watching the film.
Life should be great, not long'

This will be a benchmark for the upcoming movies of Indian cinema for years. This is how a sequel is done. This is how you build a mass following and hype while taking the movie a notch higher than the previous one. The cinematography in this movie is at par with hollywood. Something like Mad Max. The BGM is powerful like never before. The editing is done cleverly that always keeps you guessing what's in store for us in the next moment. But the emotions are the crux of this two parter movie which is highly commendable, especially when you are making an action packed mass entertainer like this. Everybody has done their work perfectly. Surely deserves a theatrical experience.

Just awesome. The experience of this magnum opus can not be described in words, it can only be felt! The Acting is superb by all the veterans, the direction is masterclass (at the beginning of his career, Prashanth is giving such amazing movies, then we can't imagine how he is going to create history in future!), Cinematography is excellent and Story, oh my God, that's just amazing! I think Bollywood's supremacy is going to be over completely soon for sure! And yeah, that's good for indian cinema, considering the nepotism and other similar factors! Regional directors are doing master work! We should encourage them to do more like this by watching such worthy stuff, instead of wasting our money in lallu-pallu scrap...

The blood-soaked land of Kolar Gold Fields (KGF) has a new overlord now - Rocky, whose name strikes fear in the heart of his foes. His allies look up to Rocky as their savior, the government sees him as a threat to law and order; enemies are clamoring for revenge and conspiring for his downfall. Bloodier battles and darker days await as Rocky continues on his quest for unchallenged supremacy.

column3: -8 Stars. No better then salmon boi's movies.
column4: I wish I could give it atleast 0 stars. Cause I would happily give it -8 stars. 1 star more because of Sanju's acting. And 1 star for the efforts on bgm, yash's style (acting was horrible tho), and some good stuff here and there to give you relief between torture.

The stars of KGF 2 are Yash and Prashanth Neel. The Kannada superstar's towering personality does full justice to the almost mythical character of Rocky Bhai. Very few stars would have made a role like Rocky Bhai believable and Yash owns it in every frame. Filmmaker Prashanth Neel ensures that the story proceeds at a brisk pace. Sanjay Dutt matches him in presence. Prakash Raj is nuanced as the narrator of the film. Raveena Tandon is impressive and you will wonder why she did not get such roles in her prime. From Rocky Bhai gaining sole control over Narachi to how he makes one quick escape to return stronger, it is one helluva ride. The visuals will linger in your memory for a long time. The team has shot at JSW sites, which gives KGF 2 the canvas of brown, grey and black. Ravi Basrur's scintillating BGM lifts up the sequences and you cannot help but stay transfixed to the screen. Another star of the film is cinematographer Bhuvan Gowda. The aesthetic of KGF 2 is a lot like Mad Max: Fury Road. Prashanth Neel who is part of the writing team ensures scenes loaded with dry humour and witty dialogues. With references to nepotism and secularism, KGF 2 taps into the modern milieu.

All I love is Ricky's acting & story & cymetrography. The movie direction is s superb. & it.this movie turned out to be great. It's a story narrated over continuously overlapping action visuals. I should say that the direction, camerawork and editing is excellent. It is on par with 300 and Sin City. The whole direction and medium used to narrate the story is superb and flows smoothly. Usually I get headaches in action movies, but this was well integrated without overpowering you. Its a must watch in a theater. The visuals on a big screen are great. If you understand the origin language - Kannada, you will enjoy the literary dialogue better, but subtitles are fair enough. When I first encountered the trailer I started comparing it with Gangs of Wasseypur. The reason was there it was story started with coal mines and here Gold mines were mentioned. After watching the movie however I got to know K. G. F. To be a kind of different movie. A movie based on a hero (or a villain). The story is a classic portrayal of waging wars against their oppressors. Few scenes made me draw comparisons to Aayirathil Oruvan & Mad Max Fury Road. The BGM along with the freeze frame action sequences worked out well.

Actually Adheera fall flat in second half of KGF: 2, when Rocky came back from Dubai with an upgraded arsenal of Kalshnikovs and rocket launchers. After his troops got slaughtered by Rocky's men, he stopped being a major threat. I even got scared by the scene when Rocky grabbed the bullet ridden injured hand of one of Garuda's henchmen and then just chopped it off, as if it's his daily business. That was a new level of brutality. When it comes to violence, Adheera was scary in first half, but as soon as Rocky Bhai upgraded his brutality level, things changed drastically. Even that machine gun scene at the police station, that fear was too level. He has that tall, muscular build, with a massive private army equipped with Kalashnikov and machine guns. And not to forget him hammering his enemies to death with hathodas. He was not in danger, but he was the danger himself.

The screenplay, cuts and sound effects deserves a standing ovation. There are illogical moments but that don't take away you, because the Director keeps you invested in the 'state of disbelief' and that is the success of this movie. There is hardly any sugarcoating to the criminal angle of Rocky, and it is more of a man with a promise to fulfill. Kudos to the entire cast and crew for a honest 'masala movie'!!

The film showcases the life and journey of Rocky after he kills Garuda in Kolar gold fields. The film is beautifully shot and every scene is a treat to watch. Director and writer Prasanth Neel's vision is superb and he presented the vision in such a manner that it is wholesome of entertainment along with every minute detail which is awesome as a viewer and movie fan ... The film is shot on a very large scale as it's main character Rocky is larger than life and the film leaves no point prooving that .. although it's a fiction but spending almost 2:45 min in theatre every single person is in awe of the protagonist Rocky as well as other characters ... And finally rocking star Yash.. needless to say it's one of the strongest and lived character we all have seen in past few years in Indian cinema..... No Bollywood , no tollywood , no Kollywood ... Kgf chapter 2 and even 1 is Indian cinema which is roaring in all over the globe and making us Indians proud bcoz the magic this film has created within a 100 crore rupees budget it's a treat to watch.

column3: MUST MUST MUST WATCH IT IN THEATRE
column4: I witnessed the second chapter of this epic action saga in cinemas as well, I found myself blown away by the gripping plot, gorgeous visuals, stunning action sequences and most importantly, Yash's screen presence as Rocky. I can safely proceed to state that my expectations were not only met, but also surpassed by this fine sequel.
Awesome movie for action lovers. Perfect music, great acting and overall a superb experience. Story is kinda original but has enough twists and turns to keep your attention. A must watch ðŸ‘Œ

The movie makes you whistle, laugh, smile, happy, sad along with heroism. At the same time, it conveys huge silence all of a sudden. Awestruck visuals, powerpack action, screenplay, and the dialogue are just amazing!

There are a couple of things to keep in mind while watching this movie. Firstly, this genre of movie is not meant to please everyone. Some might feel senseless action and flying cars which do not obey the laws of physics. This movie is not for the hypercritical. This movie has a very unique factor which is the strength of this film, which is the entertainment factor. Go to this movie leaving your physics book at home to watch fantastic visuals and very quirky conflict-ions which you might not get to see in any other genre. The strong points of this movie are Cinematography, BGM, and over the top dialogues. It is hyper dramatic and loud. But that is the style of this movie . It is more like a graphic novel made with real life action setting. Definitely go and watch this movie with your gang to have a ball , chill out, experience the bloody, cool and over the top action film like you enjoy a DWAYNE JOHNSON film. Don't try to make sense of it's quirkiness. That is the point of the movie .

Basically, I don't watch action/masala/mainstream movies. But it's a little different to me. I think it is best action film in India. Falsehood story seems to be a little more true when presented so creatively and beautifully. That should be the case with the film. As I expected or Much more than I expected. So good Direction!! Superb making as well as entertaining and outstanding... Go to the theatre and should to watch.
Blockbuster movie.. Wellmade action sequences... Loved Rockybhaii style... Story okaish... Dialogue delivery outstanding... Bgm & songs rocking... Its a most watch movie.

column3: One hell of an entertaining and larger than life experience watching it.
